Class GraphUtils

java.lang.Object
  kdl.prox.nsi2.util.GraphUtils

public class GraphUtils
extends java.lang.Object

Misc utilities on a graph

Constructor Summary
GraphUtils()
           
 
Method Summary
static void assignLinkWeightsBeta(double alpha, double beta)
          Assigns a beta distributed value (weight) to each link pdf: f(x) = k * x^(alpha-1) * (1-x)^(beta-1) with k = g(alpha+beta)/(g(alpha)*g(beta)) and g(a) being the gamma function.
static void assignLinkWeightsBinomial(int n, double p)
          Assigns a binomial distributed value (weight) to each link pmf: f(x) = (n choose x) * p^x *(1-p)^(n-x) mean: np variance: np * (1-p)
static void assignLinkWeightsExponential(double lambda)
          Assigns an exponentially distributed value (weight) to each link pdf: f(x) = ae^(-ax) mean: 1/a variance: 1/a^2
static void assignLinkWeightsUniform(double a, double b)
          Assigns a uniformly distributed value (weight) to each link pdf: f(x) = {0; for x < a, x>=b {1/(b-a) for a<=x

assignLinkWeightsUniform

public static void assignLinkWeightsUniform(double a,
                                            double b)
Assigns a uniformly distributed value (weight) to each link pdf: f(x) = {0; for x < a, x>=b {1/(b-a) for a<=x
Parameters:
a - min of distribution range
b - max of distribution range

assignLinkWeightsExponential

public static void assignLinkWeightsExponential(double lambda)
Assigns an exponentially distributed value (weight) to each link pdf: f(x) = ae^(-ax) mean: 1/a variance: 1/a^2

Parameters:
lambda - exponential paramater

assignLinkWeightsBeta

public static void assignLinkWeightsBeta(double alpha,
                                         double beta)
Assigns a beta distributed value (weight) to each link pdf: f(x) = k * x^(alpha-1) * (1-x)^(beta-1) with k = g(alpha+beta)/(g(alpha)*g(beta)) and g(a) being the gamma function. mean: alpha/(alpha + beta) variance: (alpha*beta)/[(alpha + beta)^2 * (alpha + beta + 1)]

Parameters:
alpha - paramater
beta - paramater

assignLinkWeightsBinomial

public static void assignLinkWeightsBinomial(int n,
                                             double p)
Assigns a binomial distributed value (weight) to each link pmf: f(x) = (n choose x) * p^x *(1-p)^(n-x) mean: np variance: np * (1-p)

Parameters:
n - paramater
p - paramater

flood

public static java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> flood(java.lang.Integer source,
                                                                       int max,
                                                                       Graph graph)
Floods the graph from a single source node and returns a map of distances (number of hops) for each node to the source

Parameters:
source - node to seed flood
max - maximum number of hops to flood out
graph - view of graph
Returns:
map of node ids to distance from seed

Dijkstra's algorithm Floods the graph from a single source node and returns a map of distances (shortest weighted path) for each node to the source

Parameters:
source - node to seed flood
graph - view of weighted graph
Returns:
map of node ids to distance from seed

getComponentMap

public static java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> getComponentMap(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> nodes,
                                                                                                 java.util.List<java.lang.Integer[]> edges)
Compute the connected components of the graph given the nodes and edges. Direction of edges is ignored.

Parameters:
nodes - List of nodes to be considered
edges - List of edges (2 element Integer array of o1_id, o2_id) to be considered
Returns:
A map consisting of lists of nodes corresponding to connected components. The key is an arbirtrary member of the given component.

prims

public static java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Double>> prims(Graph graph)
Compute the minimum spanning tree of the given graph using Prim's algorithm

Parameters:
graph - Graph abstraction to provide access to neighbors
Returns:
A map consisting of node -> (node -> weight) for each node in the minimum spanning tree.
